title: "The world knows now": the women who fought for justice in football’s dementia scandal
text:
Dawn Astle was with her beloved father Jeff, inside the Chapel of Rest in Burton upon Trent, when she made him her promise. “If football has done this to you, I will make sure the world knows,” she said. “I’ll make sure that we get justice for you.”

A week earlier, on what had been a gathering attended by four generations of Astles to celebrate her 34th birthday, Dawn had been trying frantically to resuscitate her 59-year-old father as he choked to death on a piece of food. Jeff was in the savage advanced stages of dementia and, while common sense and every instinct in their bodies had been telling the family that it was the result of his celebrated football career, they could have had no inkling...
